issue.title: extend weekly run timeout [skip ci]
issue.body: Extending maximum weekly constant runtime test time to 2h.

comment.body: This change allowed the constant time tests to proceed from [71%](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/runs/4676886314?check_suite_focus=true) (1h timeout) to [76%](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/runs/4745481918?check_suite_focus=true) (2h timeout) -> How many hours do we want to allow? Any algorithms to prune instead?

issue.title: ERR_SSL_VERSION_OR_CIPHER_MISMATCH on P256_KYBER90S512 for Chromium release 0.7
issue.body: Visiting https://test.openquantumsafe.org:6007/ using https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/oqs-demos/releases/download/0.7.0/chromium-ubuntu-0.7.0.tgz gives a `ERR_SSL_VERSION_OR_CIPHER_MISMATCH` error. Same for https://test.openquantumsafe.org:6010/ with the assumption of using `P256_NTRU_HPS2048509`. Maybe the paragraph with "Therefore, only the following hybrid algorithms will work" could directly link to the right port with matching working (hybrid) algorithms?

comment.body: This is a problem with our release cycle having been interrupted by the Christmas break: The test server has already been updated to the newly released liboqs v0.7.1 while the chromium binary (as all demos) has not yet been released/updated to that version. Sorry for that glitch. Will let you know here when that update is complete and everything's in sync again.

issue.title: fix default SIG_ALG from dilithium2 to dilithium3

comment.body: @Utopiah Please check out the chromium linked to `liboqs 0.7.1` at the [oqs-demos prerelease](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/oqs-demos/releases/tag/0.7.1) as to whether it still shows the same problems as described above. Thanks in advance for your feedback.

issue.title: ERR_SSL_VERSION_OR_CIPHER_MISMATCH on P256_KYBER90S512 for Chromium release 0.7
issue.body: Visiting https://test.openquantumsafe.org:6007/ using https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/oqs-demos/releases/download/0.7.0/chromium-ubuntu-0.7.0.tgz gives a `ERR_SSL_VERSION_OR_CIPHER_MISMATCH` error. Same for https://test.openquantumsafe.org:6010/ with the assumption of using `P256_NTRU_HPS2048509`. Maybe the paragraph with "Therefore, only the following hybrid algorithms will work" could directly link to the right port with matching working (hybrid) algorithms?

comment.body:
> Thanks for the clarification. Unfortunately, and I should have specified this so apologies for the confusion, I'm on Ubuntu 21.04 so that's why I specifically used chromium-ubuntu-0.7.0. Here, like then with 94 I'm getting this core dump

Hmm -- fascinating the same didn't happen with the old binary: Also that has been built only for ubuntu 20 (just like the new binary). Or are you saying standard chromium v94 also crashes on your ubuntu? Or only the oqs-chromium?

If the latter, I see two options: 1) Could you use an Ubuntu 20 VM? 2) We'd need to build a docker image to resolve this "dependency craze" for good. But as a full build alone takes many hours, doing/debugging this with a Dockerfile isn't something I'm anxiously looking forward to taking on... :-( 

If the former (every chromium v94 crashing) I think only the VM-option is realistic as we don't want to support different (i.e., also older) chromium versions.

issue.title: ERR_SSL_VERSION_OR_CIPHER_MISMATCH on P256_KYBER90S512 for Chromium release 0.7
issue.body: Visiting https://test.openquantumsafe.org:6007/ using https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/oqs-demos/releases/download/0.7.0/chromium-ubuntu-0.7.0.tgz gives a `ERR_SSL_VERSION_OR_CIPHER_MISMATCH` error. Same for https://test.openquantumsafe.org:6010/ with the assumption of using `P256_NTRU_HPS2048509`. Maybe the paragraph with "Therefore, only the following hybrid algorithms will work" could directly link to the right port with matching working (hybrid) algorithms?

comment.body:
I don't know if standard v94 Chromium crashes on 21.04 because I only have v97. What I know did crash was oqs-chromium 0.7 and 0.7.1. oqs-chromium from https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/oqs-demos/releases/download/0.7.0/chromium-ubuntu-0.7.0.tgz does run though but as mentioned to open this issue can't connect to the https://test.openquantumsafe.org on specific ports (443 is fine).

Yes I understand the problem. I would normally build from source but as you warned in the instruction a browser proper takes quite a bit of time to build, hence relying on the binaries. I can run a VM that's fine I just wanted to understand the situation and share it openly so that if others get stuck in the same way they would understand what happens.

I did actually start a VM with Ubuntu 20.04-3 and the binary works. Still get the same error message though `ERR_SSL_VERSION_OR_CIPHER_MISMATCH`. Can you please provide a full link on the test server that should work with this binary?

issue.title: extend weekly run timeout [skip ci]
issue.body: Extending maximum weekly constant runtime test time to 2h.

comment.body:
> This change allowed the constant time tests to proceed from [71%](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/runs/4676886314?check_suite_focus=true) (1h timeout) to [76%](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/runs/4745481918?check_suite_focus=true) (2h timeout) -> How many hours do we want to allow? Any algorithms to prune instead?

We could probably prune SPHINCS and Rainbow?

issue.title: Update to Picnic 3.0.9
issue.body:
WIP for a 32 bit build fix

* [No] Does this PR change the input/output behaviour of a cryptographic algorithm (i.e., does it change known answer test values)?  (If so, a version bump will be required from *x.y.z* to *x.(y+1).0*.)
* [No] Does this PR change the the list of algorithms available -- either adding, removing, or renaming?  (If so, PRs in OQS-OpenSSL, OQS-BoringSSL, and OQS-OpenSSH will also be required by the time this is merged.)

comment.body: 3.0.10 is now available and the PR is ready. It also includes a fix for #1163. I don't yet know why the SSE2/AVX2 code doesn't work on Cygwin when executed on Appveyor. With the included change SSE2/AVX2 support on Cygwin is reverted to the state before #1158.
